file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-14-04 - EXIT MARKING SIGN ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EXIT MARKING SIGN ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures for the remove/install the exit marking sign assembly. B. The exit marking sign assemblies are located: near the main door, near the service door and near the RH an LH cabin escape hatch. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY EXIT MARKING SIGN ASSEMBLY - RE- ALL 33-50-14-000-801-A MOVAL EXIT MARKING SIGN ASSEMBLY - IN- ALL 33-50-14-400-801-A STALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-14 Page 1 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-14-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. EXIT MARKING SIGN ASSEMBLY - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the exit marking sign assembly. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 231 Main door 234 Service door 251 LH cabin escape hatch 252 RH cabin escape hatch C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Performs the task Passenger cabin H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG LIGHT circuit breaker and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the two screws which attaches the electro-luminescent lamp to the exit marking sign frame. (2) Remove the exit marking sign frame. (3) Disconnect the two electrical connections. (4) Remove the electro-luminescent lamp. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-14 Page 2 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Exit Marking Sign Assembly - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONE 231 ZONE A 234 B ZONE 251 252 C D D DET. A DET. C EXIT MARKING FRAME SCREW (2) D ELECTRO-LUMINESCENT LAMP DET. D DET. B 145AMM330251.MCE EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-50-14 Page 3 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-14-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. EXIT MARKING SIGN ASSEMBLY - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the exit marking sign assembly. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500 EMERGENCY LIGHTS - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Performs the task Passenger cabin I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the electro-luminescent lamp in its installation position. (2) Connect the two electrical connections. (3) Put the exit marking sign frame in its installation position. (4) Tighten the two screws which attaches the electro-luminescent lamp to the exit marking sign frame. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the overhead circuit breaker panel, close the EMERG LIGHT circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) Do the Emergency Light Test ( AMM TASK 33-50-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-50-14 Page 4 of 4 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
